?
Guides

Guides

  • Welcome to Monitoring!

    Get the run down of how to make the most monitoring.

  • Response Time Graph

    Learn what makes the response time graph baller.

  • Intro to Breakdowns

    But wait! Before you explore the Breakdown page, either:

    1

    Click the Breakdown link for an Alert in your Alert frequency table.

    2

    Click anywhere on a synthetic test card.

  • Welcome to Monitoring Quickly learn how to:

    Isolate where alerts and problems come from.

    Analyze patterns and correlate metrics with development activity.

    Test and Monitor your app’s performance over time across different locations.

  • Pinpoint Alert Source

    1

    This map displays where alerts are coming from. Each location will show you the number of alerts, their severity, and if the location is available or unavailable.

    2

    When you start seeing alerts, click on a location on the map to filter the table below. From here, you can go to a Breakdown page to get details about an alert.

  • Test Cards

    1

    Get a glimpse of the overall health and performance of your tests.

    2

    At any moment, you can add additional synthetic tests to monitor.

  • Deployment Activity

    1

    Track your team’s Bluemix activities. You’ll be able to see them on the table and correlate them in your response and availability graphs.

  • Identify Patterns

    1

    Select the Metric, Timeframe and Test you want to visualize.

    2

    Use the time slider to see data in your desired time range.

  • Troubleshoot

    1

    Click on the Alert and Activity icons to add them to the Metric Feed on the right.

    2

    Expand and collapse your thresholds to see where your tests fall.

  • Track Performance

    1

    Click on a response dot, or availability bar, to add a data card to the Metric Feed.

    2

    Use the Metric Selection to toggle the Locations you want to view.

  • All Done

    Come back to this tutorial at any time by clicking on the question mark icon at the bottom right of your screen.

    We’ll keep you posted on future updates and new capabilities.

Skip this tutorial

  • Test Overview

    1

    Get a glimpse of the overall health and performance of your tests.

    2

    At any moment, you can add additional synthetic tests to monitor.
